bug.author: mirfan899
bug.summary: python -m spacy init-model throws AttributeError: 'tuple' object has no attribute 'shape'
bug.description:
I've created word2vec and brown clusters along with word freqs. I'm trying to build the model and getting following error: Counting frequencies... 475883it [00:01, 254354.35it/s] Reading vectors... 102454it [00:06, 15625.38it/s] Reading clusters... 614342it [00:25, 24110.31it/s] Creating model... 100%|███████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████| 28668/28668 [00:01<00:00, 26873.24it/s] Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.13_1/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/runpy.py", line 174, in _run_module_as_main "__main__", fname, loader, pkg_name) File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.13_1/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/runpy.py", line 72, in _run_code exec code in run_globals File "/Users/mirfan/PycharmProjects/urdu/spaCy/spacy/__main__.py", line 31, in <module> plac.call(commands[command], sys.argv[1:]) File "/Users/mirfan/PycharmProjects/urdu/spaCy/.env2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/plac_core.py", line 328, in call cmd, result = parser.consume(arglist) File "/Users/mirfan/PycharmProjects/urdu/spaCy/.env2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/plac_core.py", line 207, in consume return cmd, self.func(*(args + varargs + extraopts), **kwargs) File "/Users/mirfan/PycharmProjects/urdu/spaCy/spacy/cli/init_model.py", line 42, in init_model nlp = create_model(lang, probs, oov_prob, clusters, vectors_data, vector_keys, prune_vectors) File "/Users/mirfan/PycharmProjects/urdu/spaCy/spacy/cli/init_model.py", line 73, in create_model nlp.vocab.vectors = Vectors(data=vectors_data, keys=vector_keys) File "vectors.pyx", line 56, in spacy.vectors.Vectors.__init__ AttributeError: 'tuple' object has no attribute 'shape' <denchmark-h:h2>Info about spaCy</denchmark-h>
Python version: 2.7.13 Platform: Darwin-17.2.0-x86_64-i386-64bit spaCy version: 2.0.5 Models: en

comments.comment: Still same issue after cloning the spaCy today.

solution from <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jarozajac>@jarozajac</denchmark-link> related to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/issues/1832>#1832</denchmark-link> , in remove the last and in create_model() change to
